Name: Attempt to Access Child of a Non-structure Pointer
Description: Casting a non-structure type to a structure type and accessing a field can lead to memory access errors or data corruption.

CommonConsequences.Note: Adjacent variables in memory may be corrupted by assignments performed on fields after the cast.
Execution may end due to a memory access error.

PotentialMitigations.Description: The choice could be made to use a language that is not susceptible to these issues.
Review of type casting operations can identify locations where incompatible types are cast.

Entries.IntroText: The following example demonstrates the weakness.

ObservedExamples.Description: JSON decoder accesses a C union using an invalid offset to an object
